tasks.title: Test: did this task appear live?
tasks.description: If you can see this task in the Hello World app without refreshing, live reactivity works.

tasks.title: Live reactivity is working
tasks.description: This task should appear in the Todo column within 1 second of being created via MCP.

tasks.title: Fix recordDecisionMade persistence bug (session.ts:67)
tasks.description: recordDecisionMade modifies only in-memory object, never calls store.update(). decisionsMade array always empty in persisted sessions. One-line fix matching recordTaskCompleted pattern.

tasks.title: Activity stream — end-to-end (activity.json → MCP → Tauri → UI)
tasks.description: Primary dashboard view always empty. Need: activity.json file, MCP tools write events on every tool call, get_activity Tauri command, file watcher coverage, Dashboard reads live. This is the centerpiece of the vision.

tasks.title: Fix hardcoded PROJECT_PATH in config.ts
tasks.description: App only works on Patri's machine. Need Tauri store for persisted path + first-run project picker UI (directory browse button).

tasks.title: Persist Two-Strike and Approval state to disk
tasks.description: Both engines are in-memory only — state lost on MCP server restart. Need strikes.json and approvals.json via JsonStore. Also wire approvals to desktop app via Tauri command.

tasks.title: Connect WorkflowEngine to MCP server
tasks.description: WorkflowEngine (SCOPE→PLAN→BUILD→VERIFY→SHIP state machine) is built but never used. Add MCP tools: hw_get_workflow_state, hw_advance_phase, hw_get_phase_tasks.

tasks.title: Add Questions view to desktop app
tasks.description: Data model, storage, and MCP tools all exist (hw_add_question, hw_answer_question). Just needs a QuestionsView component mirroring DecisionsView, added to sidebar nav.

tasks.title: Verify live reactivity works
tasks.description: Check that Dashboard and other views update in real-time when MCP tools write to .hello-world/ JSON files.

tasks.title: Feature verification run
tasks.description: Testing all Hello World features one by one using the project itself as the template. Tasks → Memory → Decisions → Questions → Workflow → Approval → Two-Strike → Cost → Sessions.

tasks.title: Wire question answers to downstream actions (tasks/decisions)
tasks.description: When a question is answered, the answer should optionally route to a task (if it implies action) or a decision (if it reveals a tradeoff). Currently answers just sit in the Answered section with no follow-through. Could be a convention in the MCP tool, or a UI prompt after answering.

tasks.title: Add keyboard shortcuts for view switching
tasks.description: Add hotkeys to switch between views without the mouse. Suggested: 1=Dashboard, 2=Tasks, 3=Decisions, 4=Questions, 5=Memory, 6=Sessions, 7=Cost, 8=Settings. Low effort, high power-user value.

tasks.title: Connect approval queue to MCP — persist approvals to approvals.json
tasks.description: Added hw_list_approvals and hw_resolve_approval MCP tools. ApprovalGates already persisted to approvals.json — the missing piece was MCP exposure. Now Claude can list pending approvals and Pat can resolve them via MCP.

tasks.title: Auto-close orphaned sessions on new session start
tasks.description: When hw_get_context starts a new session, any previous sessions without an endedAt field should be automatically closed with a synthetic endedAt timestamp (their last recorded activity time, or the new session's startedAt). Currently all abandoned sessions show as "Active" in the Sessions view because isActive = !session.endedAt. Should only ever be one active session at a time.

tasks.title: Remove chat bridge feature
tasks.description: The terminal-based Claude CLI interface works and replaces the need for the chat bridge (hw_await_message/hw_send_response/hw_chat_status). Remove the chat bridge code, port listener, and any related UI components from the app.

tasks.title: Prime Claude with app context on terminal launch
tasks.description: Implemented via thalamus.py (SessionStart hook) + hw_write_handoff/hw_get_context restart handoff loop. Thalamus now includes Hello World (Claude Plus) section in every session briefing. settings.json has mcp__hello-world__* wildcard auto-approval.

tasks.title: Auto-initialize terminal with project context on launch
tasks.description: Fix two issues in TerminalView: (1) pass projectPath to start_pty_session so build_project_context() actually runs and injects dynamic task/phase context, (2) auto-send an init message after PTY output arrives so Claude greets Pat with project name, workflow phase, and active tasks — confirming the injection worked and removing silent startup ambiguity.

decisions.title: Use Tauri over Electron
decisions.context: Electron subprocess hangs after 6+ attempts. Need reliable process spawning.

alternatives.tradeoff: Limited UX control, plugin not product

decisions.rationale: Smaller bundle, Rust process spawning is reliable, existing React code ports directly

decisions.title: Hybrid stack: Rust I/O + TypeScript domain logic
decisions.context: Need fast I/O (process spawning, file ops) but rapid iteration on domain logic
decisions.chosen: Rust for I/O, TypeScript for brain/state/agents
decisions.rationale: Best of both worlds — reliability where it matters, iteration speed where it matters

decisions.title: Port Synaptica brain engine as memory layer
decisions.context: Need cross-session project memory. Synaptica already has hippocampal retrieval.
decisions.chosen: Port 9-stage pipeline from Synaptica, adapt to project-scoped memory
decisions.rationale: Proven architecture, pain/win/fact types, plasticity/decay already battle-tested

decisions.title: JSON file storage, swappable to SQLite
decisions.context: MSVC build tools not available at scaffold time for better-sqlite3
decisions.chosen: JsonStore with same interface, migrate to SQLite when ready
decisions.rationale: Unblocks development immediately, storage is an implementation detail

decisions.title: Remove max-w-3xl width constraint from all views
decisions.context: All list views (Memory, Decisions, Questions, Sessions, Cost) had max-w-3xl on their content containers, leaving dead horizontal space on wider screens.
decisions.chosen: Remove max-w-3xl, let cards span full width

alternatives.tradeoff: Consistent reading width but wastes screen space
Looks better than left-aligned but adds complexity

decisions.rationale: Cards filling the full width looks better and uses the available space. No content benefit to constraining width in a desktop app.

questions.question: Should Hello World support multiple projects or just one at a time?
questions.context: Currently the app is pointed at a single project path. Multi-project support would require a project switcher UI and separate data stores per project.
questions.answer: One project at a time for now. The setup screen already handles project selection. Multi-project can come later if there's demand.

questions.question: Should we add keyboard shortcuts to the Hello World desktop app?
questions.context: Currently everything is mouse-driven. Power users might want hotkeys to switch views or trigger actions.
questions.answer: Yes — basic view-switching shortcuts (1-8 for each view) would be a quick win. Low effort, high power-user appeal.

questions.question: Should the Settings view allow changing the project path without reinstalling?
questions.context: Currently project path is set once on first launch. Changing it requires manual config edits.
